text: today I'm making something really fun
it's spiced shrimp with ginger rice and
peas and the peas are cooked on top of
the ginger rice it's really easy and
it's a nice way to sort of fancy up
plain white rice or basmati rice to
start off with I'm slicing up two
scallions the greens I'm going to save
for later so those can just get set
aside and the whites I'm going to use to
flavor my rice basically what I'm doing
is making a peel off here but instead of
using classic French flavors I'm using
Asian you want to peel a piece of ginger
you need one tablespoon of minced ginger
so you'll probably need about 1 1 & a
half inches they vary so greatly in size
it's a little bit hard to say like a 2
inch piece of ginger because sometimes
they're nice and fat like this and
sometimes they're really skinny buy a
nice big piece and keep it on hand
because ginger is so great for flavoring
so many different dishes use the side of
your spoon to peel off the skin it was
probably good slice crosswise if you
don't like any of the fibers of the
ginger in your final dish you could if
you wanted to grate this on a fine
grater but I don't mind little pieces of
ginger I actually like it this looks
like a little bit more than a tablespoon
so I probably won't use it all even
though I am a bit of a ginger addict
ok good start your rice over here in a
pot heat 2 teaspoons of oil I'm trying
to be a little bit careful with the
calories so a total of 2 teaspoons
should be fine for cooking the aromatics
here
add your scallion whites and your
tablespoon of ginger let them get just
slightly aromatic which happens very
quickly coz ginger just starts off
aromatic doesn't it ginger has a high
waft ability factor what add a cup of
rice this is basmati rice white rice
works as well give it a stir a little
bit of salt and pepper not too much if
you don't care if this is vegetarian and
you're probably don't if you're making
shrimp you could use chicken stock to
cook your rice but I'm just using water
one and a half cups to cook rice you
bring it to a boil
and then reduce it to a simmer cover it
and cook it for 16 minutes when the rice
is cooked turn it off and let it sit for
5 minutes then add a cup of frozen peas
the steam from the rice will heat the
peas through and then you can stir
everything together right before you
serve it while you're waiting you can
cook your shrimp I have a pound of
shrimp here and I'm seasoning it with a
1/2 teaspoon each ground coriander and
ground cumin give it a stir and season
it with some salt and pepper
and then it gets sauteed heat another 2
teaspoons of vegetable oil takes very
little time to saute shrimp they're
fantastic weeknight meal for that reason
and you can add your shrimp if your pan
is big enough you can certainly do it in
one batch a pound of large shrimp should
fit into a 12-inch skillet without any
problem I've left the tail on these guys
but you don't need to do that a lot of
people don't really want the tail don't
want to eat around it you can remove it
I like the way that it looks and you can
pick them up by the tail and eat them
but that's just me shrimp will curl up a
little bit more become pink and opaque
when they're done beauty speedy dinner
and I think correct me if I'm wrong I
think shrimp are the most popular
seafood in America which is crazy
eat more sardines guys they're so good
for you the shrimp are done I'm turning
them off I don't want them to overcook
shrimp can be very tough when they're
overcooked this is ready to be fluffed
you can see that the peas they're bright
green but they're not wrinkly and fluff
everything if you've cooked your rice
properly it'll be nice and fluffy and
it's extremely fragrant mmm that's it
you guys super fast right that probably
took mmm 25 minutes start to finish for
dinner serve up some shrimp on top I
think it's a restaurant worthy dish what
do you think little squeeze a lime seals
the deal
